2074.subject: KIN
2074.descrlong: Develops skills in health counseling: data interpretation, goal setting, planning strategies for lifelong health and wellness behavior change, improvement and prevention through pragmatic implementation.  Prepares students to develop strategies and skills in understanding and implementing behavior change models and to facilitate support strategies in community and worksite settings. The student recognizes the dynamic wellness process, becoming proactive in both self and environmental responsibility for a higher quality of life.  (Offered as needed).
